text: Your class may have visited a nearby coastal area that is vulnerable to erosion. If you haven't, take a peek at this video on coastal erosion. Then answer these questions with your group.
You can drag images out of this activity, or upload them from your computer, or draw pictures to support your point of view.

1. What do you think is important to know about or from this place? Why do you think it is important to know these things about this place?
  2. How do you think we can learn about this place? Why do you think these are good ways to learn about this place?
  3. Do you think people are a part of this place? If yes, how do you think people are a part of this place? If no, why do you think people are separate from this place?
  4. What do you think peoplesâ€™ role in this place should be? For example, how should people act in this place? How should people treat this place?
  5. What do you think an elder might think or say or do about coastal erosion?
  6. How has the coastline changed over time and how has it affected your life?
